controlRequirement: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent the unauthorized disclosure of CUI during transmission and while in storage.

settings.displayName: Require BitLocker Encryption on Windows Devices
settings.description: Requires BitLocker encryption to be enabled on Windows devices to protect CUI data at rest. Non-compliant devices are blocked from accessing corporate resources through Conditional Access integration.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Navigate to Microsoft Intune admin center > Devices > Compliance policies
2. Create Windows compliance policy
3. Configure System Security > Require encryption of data storage on device = Require
4. Set Actions for noncompliance (e.g., block access after 1 day)
5. Assign to all Windows device groups
6. Configure Conditional Access to require compliant devices
7. Monitor compliance status in Intune dashboard

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Device compliance requirement for encryption directly enforces NIST requirement for protecting CUI data at rest. BitLocker provides FIPS 140-2 validated cryptographic protection for storage devices. Combined with Conditional Access, this prevents unencrypted devices from accessing sensitive data.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure of CUI while in storage

settings.displayName: BitLocker Operating System Drive Encryption Method
settings.description: Configures BitLocker to use XTS-AES 256-bit encryption for operating system drives, providing strong cryptographic protection for CUI stored on system volumes.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Navigate to Microsoft Intune admin center > Endpoint security > Disk encryption
2. Create new BitLocker policy or use Security Baseline
3. Configure BitLocker > Select encryption method for operating system drives = XTS-AES 256-bit
4. Configure recovery key escrow to Azure AD
5. Assign policy to Windows device groups
6. Allow 24-48 hours for encryption to complete
7. Verify encryption status in Intune encryption report

controlMappings.mappingRationale: XTS-AES 256-bit provides industry-standard strong encryption for operating system drives containing CUI. This encryption method is FIPS 140-2 validated and meets federal cryptographic requirements for protecting sensitive data at rest.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure of CUI while in storage

settings.displayName: BitLocker Fixed Data Drive Encryption Method
settings.description: Configures BitLocker to use XTS-AES 256-bit encryption for fixed data drives, ensuring all internal storage volumes containing CUI are cryptographically protected.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Navigate to Microsoft Intune admin center > Endpoint security > Disk encryption
2. Open BitLocker policy or Security Baseline
3. Configure BitLocker > Select encryption method for fixed data drives = XTS-AES 256-bit
4. Enable 'Deny write access to fixed drives not protected by BitLocker'
5. Configure recovery key backup to Azure AD
6. Assign to all Windows devices with fixed data drives
7. Monitor encryption status through Intune reports

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Fixed data drives often contain large volumes of CUI. XTS-AES 256-bit encryption ensures secondary internal drives receive the same strong cryptographic protection as the OS drive, preventing data exposure if drives are physically removed.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure of CUI while in storage

settings.description: Configures BitLocker to use AES-CBC 256-bit encryption for removable drives, protecting CUI on USB drives and external storage devices.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Navigate to Microsoft Intune admin center > Endpoint security > Disk encryption
2. Open BitLocker policy
3. Configure BitLocker > Select encryption method for removable data drives = AES-CBC 256-bit
4. Enable 'Deny write access to removable drives not protected by BitLocker'
5. Configure password policy for removable drives
6. Assign to all Windows devices
7. Educate users on encrypting USB drives before storing CUI

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Removable drives pose significant data loss risk. AES-CBC 256-bit encryption (note: CBC mode for compatibility with removable drives) ensures CUI transferred to USB drives or external storage remains protected even if the physical device is lost or stolen.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure of CUI while in storage

settings.description: Requires devices to be compliant (including encryption requirements) before accessing Microsoft 365 resources. This ensures only encrypted devices can access and store CUI in cloud services.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Navigate to Azure AD admin center > Security > Conditional Access
2. Create new Conditional Access policy
3. Assignments > Users: Include all users handling CUI
4. Cloud apps: Select Microsoft 365 services (Exchange, SharePoint, OneDrive, Teams)
5. Conditions: All device platforms
6. Grant controls > Require device to be marked as compliant
7. Enable policy and monitor sign-in logs
8. Review blocked sign-ins and remediate non-compliant devices

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Conditional Access enforces encryption requirements by blocking access from non-compliant (unencrypted) devices. This prevents CUI from being accessed, downloaded, or stored on devices that lack proper cryptographic protection, enforcing encryption for both data in transit (TLS connections) and at rest.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure of CUI during transmission and while in storage

settings.displayName: Microsoft Purview Message Encryption - Enable Azure RMS
settings.description: Enables Azure Rights Management Service for Microsoft Purview Message Encryption, allowing encrypted email transmission and ensuring CUI in emails remains encrypted during transmission and when stored in mailboxes.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Connect to Exchange Online PowerShell with Global Admin or Compliance Admin credentials
2. Run: Get-IRMConfiguration to check current status
3. Run: Set-IRMConfiguration -AzureRMSLicensingEnabled $true
4. Verify with: Test-IRMConfiguration -Sender <email> -Recipient <email>
5. Configure mail flow rules in Exchange admin center for automatic encryption
6. Create encryption rules based on sensitivity labels or content inspection
7. Test encrypted message sending and receiving
8. Monitor encrypted messages through Message Trace

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Azure RMS enables message-level encryption for emails containing CUI. Unlike TLS which only encrypts transmission, Message Encryption keeps emails encrypted at rest in mailboxes and during transmission. This ensures CUI in emails cannot be read by unauthorized parties even if email systems are compromised.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure of CUI during transmission
